Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Type, format, proofread, and edit correspondence and other documents, from notes or dictating machines, using computers or typewriters.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Complete work schedules, manage calendars, and arrange appointments.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Review files, records, and other documents to obtain information to respond to requests.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Deliver messages and run errands.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Inventory and order materials, supplies, and services.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Troubleshoot problems involving office equipment, such as computer hardware and software.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Collect, count, and disburse money, do basic bookkeeping, and complete banking transactions.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Complete and mail bills, contracts, policies, invoices, or checks.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Process and prepare documents, such as business or government forms and expense reports.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Monitor and direct the work of lower-level clerks.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Make travel arrangements for office personnel.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Train other staff members to perform work activities, such as using computer applications.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Prepare meeting agendas, attend meetings, and record and transcribe minutes.

Title: Office Clerks, General
Task: Count, weigh, measure, or organize materials.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Sort, assemble, and proof completed work.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Set up and adjust machines, regulating factors such as speed, ink flow, focus, and number of copies.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Monitor machine operation, and make adjustments as necessary to ensure proper operation.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Load machines with materials such as blank paper or film.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Maintain stock of supplies, and requisition any needed items.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: File and store completed documents.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Clean machines, perform minor repairs, and report major repair needs.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Operate auxiliary machines such as collators, pad and tablet making machines, staplers, and paper punching, folding, cutting, and perforating machines.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Prepare and process papers for use in scanning, microfilming, and microfiche.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Cut copies apart and write identifying information, such as page numbers or titles, on copies.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Clean and file master copies or plates.

Title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer
Task: Move heat units and clamping frames over screen beds to form Braille impressions on pages, raising frames to release individual copies.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Correct or record omissions, errors, or inconsistencies found.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Mark copy to indicate and correct errors in type, arrangement, grammar, punctuation, or spelling, using standard printers' marks.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Read corrected copies or proofs to ensure that all corrections have been made.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Compare information or figures on one record against same data on other records, or with original copy, to detect errors.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Consult reference books or secure aid of readers to check references with rules of grammar and composition.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Route proofs with marked corrections to authors, editors, typists, or typesetters for correction or reprinting.

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers

Title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers
Task: Read proof sheets aloud, calling out punctuation marks and spelling unusual words and proper names.

Title: Statistical Assistants

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Check source data to verify completeness and accuracy.

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Enter data into computers for use in analyses or reports.

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Compile reports, charts, or graphs that describe and interpret findings of analyses.

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Participate in the publication of data or information.

Task: File data and related information and maintain and update databases.

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Organize paperwork, such as survey forms or reports, for distribution or analysis.

Title: Statistical Assistants

Title: Statistical Assistants

Task: Discuss data presentation requirements with clients.

Title: Statistical Assistants
Task: Send out surveys.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Maintain awareness of new and emerging computational methods and technologies.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Conduct quality analyses of data inputs and resulting analyses or predictions.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Enter or retrieve information from structural databases, protein sequence motif databases, mutation databases, genomic databases or gene expression databases.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Develop or maintain applications that process biologically based data into searchable databases for purposes of analysis, calculation, or presentation.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Confer with researchers, clinicians, or information technology staff to determine data needs and programming requirements and to provide assistance with database-related research activities.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Participate in the preparation of reports or scientific publications.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Write computer programs or scripts to be used in querying databases.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Document all database changes, modifications, or problems.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Create data management or error-checking procedures and user manuals.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Develop or apply data mining and machine learning algorithms.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Design or implement web-based tools for querying large-scale biological databases.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Monitor database performance and perform any necessary maintenance, upgrades, or repairs.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Confer with database users about project timelines and changes.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Perform routine system administrative functions such as troubleshooting, back-ups, and upgrades.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Package bioinformatics data for submission to public repositories.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Train bioinformatics staff or researchers in the use of databases.

Title: Bioinformatics Technicians
Task: Test new or updated software or tools and provide feedback to developers.

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Logging Workers

Task: Monitor logging operations to identify and solve problems, improve work methods, and ensure compliance with safety, company, and government regulations.

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Logging Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Logging Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Logging Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers
Task: Train workers in spawning, rearing, cultivating, and harvesting methods, and in the use of equipment.

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers
Task: Requisition supplies.

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: First-Line Supervisors of Aquacultural Workers

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors
Task: Verify that transportation and handling procedures meet regulatory requirements.

Title: Agricultural Inspectors
Task: Inspect the cleanliness and practices of establishment employees.

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Agricultural Inspectors

Title: Solar Energy Installation Managers

Title: Boilermakers

Title: Boilermakers

Title: Boilermakers

Title: Engine and Other Machine Assemblers

Title: Engine and Other Machine Assemblers
Task: Lay out and drill, ream, tap, or cut parts for assembly.

Title: Engine and Other Machine Assemblers

Title: Engine and Other Machine Assemblers
Task: Maintain and lubricate parts or components.

Title: Structural Metal Fabricators and Fitters

Title: Structural Metal Fabricators and Fitters
Task: Direct welders to build up low spots or short pieces with weld.

Title: Bakers

Title: Bakers

Title: Bakers
Task: Observe color of products being baked and adjust oven temperatures, humidity, or conveyor speeds accordingly.

Title: Bakers
Task: Check the quality of raw materials to ensure that standards and specifications are met.

Task: Check equipment to ensure that it meets health and safety regulations and perform maintenance or cleaning, as necessary.

Title: Bakers
Task: Adapt the quantity of ingredients to match the amount of items to be baked.

Title: Bakers
Task: Direct or coordinate bakery deliveries.

Title: Bakers
Task: Order or receive supplies or equipment.

Title: Bakers
Task: Prepare or maintain inventory or production records.

Title: Bakers
Task: Operate slicing or wrapping machines.

Title: Bakers
Task: Develop new recipes for baked goods.

Title: Food Batchmakers

Title: Food Batchmakers

Title: Railroad Conductors and Yardmasters
Task: Instruct workers to regulate air conditioning, lighting, and heating in passenger cars to ensure passengers' comfort.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Inspect vehicles to detect any damage.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Perform cash handling tasks, such as making change, balancing and recording cash drawer, or distributing tips.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Explain and calculate parking charges, collect fees from customers, and respond to customer complaints.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Park and retrieve automobiles for customers in parking lots, storage garages, or new car lots.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Provide customer assistance and information, such as giving directions or handling wheelchairs.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Keep parking areas clean and orderly to ensure that space usage is maximized.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Call emergency responders or the proper authorities and provide motorist assistance, such as giving directions or helping jump start a stalled vehicle.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Patrol parking areas to prevent vehicle damage and vehicle or property thefts.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Direct motorists to parking areas or parking spaces, using hand signals or flashlights as necessary.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Escort customers to their vehicles to ensure their safety.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Perform maintenance on cars in storage to protect tires, batteries, or exteriors from deterioration.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Perform personnel activities, such as supervising or scheduling employees.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Review motorists' identification before allowing them to enter parking facilities.

Title: Parking Lot Attendants
Task: Service vehicles with gas, oil, and water.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Clean parking areas, offices, restrooms, or equipment and remove trash.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Clean windshields, and/or wash and wax vehicles.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Provide customers with information about local roads or highways.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Perform minor repairs, such as adjusting brakes, replacing spark plugs, or changing engine oil or filters.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Order stock and price and shelve incoming goods.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Rotate, test, and repair or replace tires.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Sell prepared food, groceries, or related items.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Maintain customer records and follow up periodically with telephone, mail, or personal reminders of services due.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Grease and lubricate vehicles or specified units, such as springs, universal joints, or steering knuckles, using grease guns or spray lubricants.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Sell and install accessories, such as batteries, windshield wiper blades, fan belts, bulbs, or headlamps.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Test and charge batteries.

Title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants
Task: Operate car washes.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Inspect work of aircraft mechanics performing maintenance, modification, or repair and overhaul of aircraft and aircraft mechanical systems to ensure adherence to standards and procedures.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Examine aircraft access plates and doors for security.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Examine landing gear, tires, and exteriors of fuselage, wings, and engines for evidence of damage or corrosion and the need for repairs.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Examine maintenance records and flight logs to determine if service and maintenance checks and overhauls were performed at prescribed intervals.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Inspect new, repaired, or modified aircraft to identify damage or defects and to assess airworthiness and conformance to standards, using checklists, hand tools, and test instruments.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Prepare and maintain detailed repair, inspection, investigation, and certification records and reports.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Approve or deny issuance of certificates of airworthiness.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Conduct flight test programs to test equipment, instruments, and systems under a variety of conditions, using both manual and automatic controls.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Investigate air accidents and complaints to determine causes.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Observe flight activities of pilots to assess flying skills and to ensure conformance to flight and safety regulations.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Start aircraft and observe gauges, meters, and other instruments to detect evidence of malfunctions.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Recommend replacement, repair, or modification of aircraft equipment.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Analyze training programs and conduct oral and written examinations to ensure the competency of persons operating, installing, and repairing aircraft equipment.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Recommend changes in rules, policies, standards, and regulations, based on knowledge of operating conditions, aircraft improvements, and other factors.

Title: Aviation Inspectors
Task: Schedule and coordinate in-flight testing programs with ground crews and air traffic control to ensure availability of ground tracking, equipment monitoring, and related services.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Inspect vehicles or other equipment for evidence of abuse, damage, or mechanical malfunction.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Inspect vehicles or equipment to ensure compliance with rules, standards, or regulations.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Inspect repairs to transportation vehicles or equipment to ensure that repair work was performed properly.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Identify modifications to engines, fuel systems, emissions control equipment, or other vehicle systems to determine the impact of modifications on inspection procedures or conclusions.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Perform low-pressure fuel evaluative tests (LPFET) to test for harmful emissions from vehicles without onboard diagnostics (OBD) equipment.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Conduct remote inspections of motor vehicles, using handheld controllers and remotely directed vehicle inspection devices.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Prepare reports on investigations or inspections and actions taken.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Monitor or review output from systems, such as Thermal Imaging Units (TIU) or roadside imaging tools, to identify high risk commercial motor vehicles for follow-up inspections.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Issue notices and recommend corrective actions when infractions or problems are found.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Compare emissions findings with applicable emissions standards.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Evaluate new methods of packaging, testing, shipping, or transporting hazardous materials to ensure adequate public safety protection.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Investigate and make recommendations on carrier requests for waiver of federal standards.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Conduct visual inspections of emission control equipment and smoke emitted from gasoline or diesel vehicles.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Conduct vehicle or transportation equipment tests, using diagnostic equipment.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Identify emissions testing procedures and standards appropriate for the age and technology of vehicles.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Investigate incidents or violations, such as delays, accidents, and equipment failures.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Negotiate with authorities, such as local government officials, to eliminate hazards along transportation routes.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Review commercial vehicle logs, shipping papers, or driver and equipment records to detect any problems or to ensure compliance with regulations.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Attach onboard diagnostics (OBD) scanner cables to vehicles to conduct emissions inspections.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Investigate complaints regarding safety violations.

Title: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
Task: Examine carrier operating rules, employee qualification guidelines, or carrier training and testing programs for compliance with regulations or safety standards.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Prepare and submit reports after completion of freight shipments.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Inspect shipments to ensure that freight is securely braced and blocked.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Record details about freight conditions, handling of freight, and any problems encountered.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Advise crews in techniques of stowing dangerous and heavy cargo.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Observe loading of freight to ensure that crews comply with procedures.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Recommend remedial procedures to correct any violations found during inspections.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Measure ships' holds and depths of fuel and water in tanks, using sounding lines and tape measures.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Direct crews to reload freight or to insert additional bracing or packing as necessary.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Check temperatures and humidities of shipping and storage areas to ensure that they are at appropriate levels to protect cargo.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Read draft markings to determine depths of vessels in water.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Issue certificates of compliance for vessels without violations.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Write certificates of admeasurement that list details such as designs, lengths, depths, and breadths of vessels, and methods of propulsion.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Calculate gross and net tonnage, hold capacities, volumes of stored fuel and water, cargo weights, and ship stability factors, using mathematical formulas.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Measure heights and widths of loads to ensure they will pass over bridges or through tunnels on scheduled routes.

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors

Title: Freight and Cargo Inspectors
Task: Determine types of licenses and safety equipment required, and compute applicable fees such as tolls and wharfage fees.

Title: Transportation Attendants, Except Flight Attendants

Title: Transportation Attendants, Except Flight Attendants

Title: Crane and Tower Operators

Title: Crane and Tower Operators

Title: Crane and Tower Operators

Title: Crane and Tower Operators

Title: Crane and Tower Operators

Title: Industrial Truck and Tractor Operators

Title: Industrial Truck and Tractor Operators

Title: Industrial Truck and Tractor Operators

Title: Industrial Truck and Tractor Operators

Title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment

Title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment

Title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment

Title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment
Task: Lubricate machinery, vehicles, or equipment or perform minor repairs or adjustments, using hand tools.

Title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment
